title: The City as man's home
creator_contributor_role: National Film Board of Canada, production company
subject_group: Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Housing
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Community development
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Housing - Social aspects
description: Episode number 5 of Series "Lewis Mumford on the city". Slums, giant public housing complexes, mass suburbs, anonymous and bleak luxury apartments - almost everywhere in cities communal standards of living are falling even as personal standards of living rise. How did this happen and what can our cities do to improve communal living standards? These problems are discussed and fully illustrated.
